content.description: On the left side of the amphitheater bowl (about 10' to the left of Fork n' Hello) this climb starts on a crack/groove that trends left but ultimately aiming for a small roof about 50' up.   You can climb over the roof (left side is easier) and there is a good tree anchor.

Start in the middle of the Amphitheater; there are two crack systems (on either side of a groove) that will take gear.  The left variation is marginally more difficult and slippery (from moss).  Climb to a stance/ledge just below where two upper cracks split in different directions.  Follow the right crack that has an undercling move (or two), and finish on a slab covered with pine needles.
content.location: Middle of the Amphitheater, which is visible (about 300') from the road.  Look for the distinguishable groove at the slabby start.  This is to the left of the dirty, left-facing corner.

content.description: Beautiful sustained finger crack up the west side of the central amphitheater crags. Slight draw back is in the fall, leaves accumulate on some of it's footholds. Climber may need to do some excavating with a nut pick to get leaves out of the way for stopper placements. If the climb had traffic it wouldn't be like this.
content.protection: Lots of small to medium wires. Trees for belay
content.location: slightly uphill on the west side of central amphitheater crags. Rappelling is easiest or head up and wander down easterly.

content.description: The first area you come to from the lower parking on the cliff-side of the road.
